metadata.title: ruby: openssl: Ruby Marvin Attack (moderate)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A vulnerability was found in Ruby. The Ruby interpreter is vulnerable to the Marvin Attack. This attack allows the attacker to decrypt previously encrypted messages or forge signatures by exchanging a large number of messages with the vulnerable service. 
            STATEMENT: More information about the Marvin Attack may be found at https://www.redhat.com/en/blog/marvin-attack.
            MITIGATION: See the following possible mitigations for this flaw:

* Do not use the methods with PKCS#1v1.5 padding in network contexts. Make sure that any calls that happen, will perform OAEP decryption only. Do not support PKCS#1v1.5 encryption padding at all.

* Use Ruby with a version of OpenSSL that has the implicit rejection mechanism implemented.(https://github.com/openssl/openssl/pull/13817, https://github.com/openssl/openssl/commit/7fc67e0a33102aa47bbaa56533eeecb98c0450f7 included in 3.2.0, backported to RHEL-8)
